experience: Congrats to Huey Wen Lee, Ph.D., who got hired as a Medical Science Liaison at AstraZeneca.
Watch to see how Huey got into a highly competitive industry job despite not knowing how to write a resume and not knowing what jobs were available to PhDs like her.
Learn how to get hired into industry here (opens THIS Monday, November 6th at 8AM EST): https://lnkd.in/di86xVm
What is the link between our gut microbiome and our immune system? A new Annals paper explores. Read here: https://lnkd.in/efvRURB

At Affinergy I have the opportunity to use my scientific background and research skills to find new areas in which to apply our patented technology to improve medicine and human health. Working together with the scientific and technology development teams, as well as key opinion leaders, I identify unmet needs in healthcare that we can address with our technology. I then develop research and development plans to assess feasibility, and perform market research to identify factors that will best position our products for user adoption and market penetration. Together with my technology development teammate, I am also responsible for writing efforts and science communication.
Participant in 1st Cohort of reacHIRE in Research Triangle Park (Raleigh, North Carolina)

reacHIRE is a comprehensive workforce re-entry program that provides experiential career training and development for accomplished women.  Certification includes professional and technical skills refresh, presentation skills and interpersonal dynamics workshops, project management training, career coaching, and a paid, project assignment at a leading company.

Selection of Recent Professional Development Activities:•       Research Commercialization Introductory Course: NCET2 (100C: 13-6. )  2013•	Introduction to Business Fundamentals: Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley (MBA 209F)        2013                 •      US Food and Drug Administration, Drug Development, Science and Health Policy Course, UC        Berkeley.  Instructors:  Dr. Veronica Miller and Dr. Jur Strobos   2014 •      Workshop  on Scientific Teaching (SEPAL at SF State)   2014•      Excel, PowerPoint and Word Special Topics, NC State TTS, 5 hours of instruction. 2015

Robert Black Family Damon Runyon Cancer Research Foundation Postdoctoral Fellow ('10-'13), David Bilder's Lab, MCBLead Scientist on two projects focusing on different aspects of tumor biology.•	Primary project aimed to broaden our understanding of the role of epithelial remodeling in        cancer progression and identify new targets for cancer therapeutics:  obtained a highly          competitive fellowship for this project and was selected to present this work in platform         presentations at three International Meetings, one of which garnered a Best Postdoctoral         Presentation Award•	Second project aimed to characterize a novel role for a known tumor suppressor         in regulating cell polarity.  From this project I produced one primary and one contributing author         publication in two respected journals in the fields of Development and Biochemistry.Areas of research focus:  cell polarity, development, epithelial-mesenchymal transition, tumorigenesis, cellular dynamics, high resolution live imaging, ubiquitination,  protein degradation
Hospital for Sick Children Research Institute

During my doctoral studies I identified a novel way in which cells regulate a highly conserved signalling pathway (Notch) during development. From this work I published two first author papers, one contributing author paper and received several awards, including the Margaret Thompson Award for Best Ph.D. Thesis from the Genetics Society of Canada (2010), Brain Star Award from the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (2009) and Best Student Presentation at the Genetics Society of Canada's 50th Anniversary Meeting (2007). Areas of research focus:  membrane trafficking, endocytosis, ubiquitination, Notch signalling, phospholipids

recommendations: February 9, 2014, Lara worked with Lucy Erin in the same group

Lara is smart, motivated, insightful, and has a real talent for getting the details right while seeing the big picture.  She thrives on a challenge and pulls far more than her own weight in a team setting.

summary: Enterprising and versatile PhD trained Life Scientist driven to understand and improve our world.  I thrive in dynamic environments, love working within a team and have a keen interest in continued learning. I have strong analytical skills, high emotional intelligence and an established track record in managing and contributing to multiple projects at once.  I am well recognized as a team player who can keep track of details while always keeping the big picture in mind.
name: Lara Skwarek, Ph.D
title: Energetic Life Scientist* Collaborative Problem Solver* Endlessly Curious* Tech Development and Scientific Communication
